physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Clinical examination revealed seven soft, palpable, non-tender nodules with a maximum diameter of 40 mm on both elbows, extensor surface of wrists, and knees. Painful swelling of both third metacarpophalangeal joints (MCP) and wrists was noted. No skin thickenings, sclerodactyly, finger contractures, or Raynaud's phenomenon were detected.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The nodules had been gradually increasing in size over the last 3 months, but remained stable after treatment.
